intro: Hieracium oligolophum, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, blooming from June to August. Hieracium oligolophum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
